proof.text: For let two rational straight lines ,  commensurable in square only be added together;  I say that the whole  is irrational.

For, since  is incommensurable in length with — for they are commensurable in square only— and, as  is to , so is the rectangle ,  to the square on , therefore the rectangle ,  is incommensurable with the square on . [elem.10.11
]

But the sum of the squares on ,  is rational; therefore the square on  is irrational, so that  is also irrational. [elem.10.def.4
]
